website_summaries.verdict: A simplistic, well-received French press that has been in production since the 1980s.
pros: Has been favorably compared to more expensive French presses
cons: Certain pouring angles will introduce grounds into the brew

customer_reviews.title: I should have listened to the reviews...
customer_reviews.text: I typically do an unnecessary amount of research before buying anything and this french press was no different. I was surprised when it arrived in one piece, that's how much I wasn't expecting much. So anyway, that was a win...TWO DAYS LATER, the stopper broke and the wire pieces came loose. TWO DAYS! And this was the exact same problem that someone posted about in their review. Pictures and everything! It was like mine and theirs were kindred spirits. Romeo and Juliet, doomed to die the same way. Terrible.
customer_reviews.author: kegreat

customer_reviews.title: Fragile
customer_reviews.text: A bump against the trash can (plastic) caused a crack in the body that rendered the press unusable. I purchased a second one that cracked when hot water was added to the coffee. Run, do not walk away from this product. I have learned my lesson and will purchase a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: heysox

customer_reviews.title: Size comparison
customer_reviews.text: I use this to make tea for myself. Ordered 2 sizes. 3 cup = smaller than a regular glass, too small. 8 cup = about 3 glasses, a bit too big for one person. See my pictures. The tea I made in 2nd picture fills a glass. I'm keeping the 8 cup one, it's well made and color is nice. Wish there's some in between sizes though.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Broken under 2 months.
customer_reviews.text: I'm rating this low because it's broken after less than 2 months of use. It was fine until this. That black plastic piece seems to be what holds it in place. It has broken from the base. There are threads that won't grab and it's useless now.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Jensen

customer_reviews.title: I was planning to return this but of course like most things I've missed the mark
customer_reviews.text: The French press I received is different than the one in the photo. I was planning to return this but of course like most things I've missed the mark. honestly I'll probably end up giving it away because I don't like the way it works. The lid is not the same shape as the one I picked out leaving a gap in addition to being kind of awkward to put it on. I just wish that photos matched what you actually received in the mail.
customer_reviews.author: Kara

customer_reviews.title: Coffee grounds always came through but got worse...
customer_reviews.text: Bigger is not always better. Buy the smaller one!!! The stem part broke and I fixed it. Then it broke again! Coffee grounds always came through no matter what but just got worse the more we used it! Biggest piece of crap. Do NOT buy this product. You’ll thank me later.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: A perfect mini version of the one I have at home
customer_reviews.text: FYI - This 3 cup press makes enough coffee for a single mug. A perfect mini version of the one I have at home. So, fresh coffee every mug, if your into that hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Phil McKracken

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy plastic piece quickly creates a point of failure
customer_reviews.text: I happily owned this French Press for 8 weeks and used (not abused) it once or twice a day before the tiny piece of plastic that held the lid onto the stem broke away from the lid. That tiny bit of plastic - now sliding up and down the stem - was what kept the large plastic top of the press anchored to the stem so that during press time the stem remained stable and centered. I now have a wobbly, sometimes ineffective, French press that can't always be pressed. Given the purpose of a coffee press, it would seem the design would account for actual use. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Christine D

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for one!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to keep at my boyfriend’s house since he doesn’t drink coffee and I need my fix when I’m at his place. I absolutely love it and may order another for my house. I have an expensive coffee machine at home that I’m also addicted to, but this little French press is perfect for one cup (2 servings) if I don’t want to use my machine. It’s dishwasher safe so it cleans up easily.
customer_reviews.author: Valkyrie

customer_reviews.title: Glass is too thin they break frequently and are a hazard
customer_reviews.text: I know of four occasions when these have broken in last few years, two of which I broke myself. Once by a renter at my ski house I don't have any details on this one, second time broke while a friend was plunging and she had to go to ER because hot water scalded her leg, I broke one putting it into the dish rack then finally couple months ago I broke one while pulling up on the plunger the glass just broke. The glass is too thin and too weak these are dangerous in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: best of all my "teapots"
customer_reviews.text: I brew a full pot of tea in it every morning. Stays warm a surprisingly long time, and can be warmed in the microwave if it does cool off. Metal parts do stain and are not easy to return to their original shine, but it doesn't really matter. Glass is breakable, so do be careful, but this brand has the most durable carafe (I've broken a few, but only one of the bodum). You can also get it in plastic if you don't want to take the risk. Lightweight (plastic one is even lighter) compared to other teapots. My favorite tea pot, and I've had many.
customer_reviews.author: lisa

customer_reviews.title: Safety Hazard due to poor design...they keep making it worse...
customer_reviews.text: My Bodum presses from 20 years ago were far better. The cheap parts aside as mentioned by others , there is one glaring problem that makes me batchit nutz......The bottom of the frame traps water (left from rinsing or pouring)....After steeping your drink, as you're pouring you're going to get about a teaspoon of very hot water dripping out of the perimeter of the plastic base. I wanted to disassemble (it appears you can) and drill some holes in the plastic base to avert this....But I couldn't pull the glass out. It's pretty obvious they make design changes without any field testing. It's very easy to get scalded.
customer_reviews.author: skippythedog

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use, easy to clean, perfect for a single cup!
customer_reviews.text: The perfect little vessel for a quick cuppa, without commiting to a whole pot! I’m thrilled with my adorable, and aesthetically pleasing Bodum press. I got a large one some time ago, which I’ve loved for when we have company, (or after a sleepless night :)) but sometimes I just need a single cup, just for me. This is the perfect size, and is easy to clean. Consistent delicious pressed coffee, every time. And look how cute it is next to it’s big brother!
customer_reviews.author: Kora66

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 1 year.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in Feb 2019 and writing this review in Feb 2020. I used this probably once a week or less given I also had an espresso machine but just last week in using it again both the mesh and metal filter layers just fell off. Can't fix it back without glue or something that was clearly adhering the pieces together (not screwed on or anything)... I'm disappointed this broke just like that after just 1 year of non-regular use. I can't imagine this would've lasted more than a few months if I had used it everyday like I'm sure some people intend to. I don't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: MAKES GREAT COFFEE
customer_reviews.text: Treat it right and it will treat you right. The directions are pretty simple. Don't force the plunger down. Don't blast rapidly boiling water into it (not good for coffee either), don't drop it on a bad day. It is important the screen stays properly attached. This is what will ruin your $20 French press over the years. Just rinse it clean and don't man-handle or neglect it. Very simple, elegant piece of work I later saw was available at our local grocery store at the same price. I would buy this brand again. Works better for two people. I can't quite put the right amount of water in for my desired strength plus pour-ability. The filter-plunger is too good??
customer_reviews.author: LIBRARY GIRL

customer_reviews.title: I like it a lot
customer_reviews.text: I like it a lot. Two things that I wish this press had though, that I didn't realize it hadn't upon ordering are: -A lid that can rotate so that the slotted part of the spout can be blocked (there is a groove in the lid so the handle locks it into only 1 position.) -Level/measurement markings on the side so I don't have to use a separate water measuring cup if I don't want to make a full pot. Those 2 things are the difference between great and perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Nekogeisha

customer_reviews.title: Great little press
customer_reviews.text: I use this for cold brew only. Filter screen is sufficient to filter out all but a grain or two of coffee grounds. Great for single person use. Works exactly what I need it for. Easy enough to clean. Filter screen easily cleaned with a faucet rinse and unscrews to deep clean. I got a little excited shaking out the water during cleaning and the top handle lip popped off the top. Luckily the cup landed softly and didn't break. I have long skinny hands and the cup is narrow even for me. But I can still get my hand far enough in to wipe out water or residue. Would use a bottle brush if I cared.
customer_reviews.author: Miz Booshi

customer_reviews.title: Hope you like drinking coffee grinds
customer_reviews.text: This review is only for the 12 ounce version. The 32 ounce one is perfect. Coffee grinds always make it into my cup with this one. You can even see the coffee grinds that make their way around the filter when you press the plunger down. But this is only with the 12 ounce one. This is my second 12 ounce one and they both do the same thing. The larger 32 ounce one doesn't do this. I had two of those as well, and both 32 ounce ones never had an issue. Just stay away from the 12 ounce one and you'll be happy.
customer_reviews.author: Eric W.

customer_reviews.title: Still Great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace exactly the same model that I bought about 10 years ago, which finally gave up the ghost when my little sister was over. She swears that it cracked because of hot water, but she is the family klutz, so I can only assume that it died after she dropped it, stuck it in the coldest fluid she could find, and then poured hot water on it. I say that because I used it almost every day for 10 years and it never had problem with temperature shock in all that time. Anyways. I bought another because I loved the first one, if that tells you anything about the quality.
customer_reviews.author: metasynergy

customer_reviews.title: Warped mesh permits grounds in coffee
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had the same brand of coffee press for years and buy a new press each time the glass breaks (because I’m clumsy). The newest press I ordered is not the same quality as the presses I’ve owned in the past. This press has mesh that is warped and allows a lot of grounds to go into my coffee. I’ve tried to reform the mesh myself but it doesn’t work. I hope the brands quality is not going downhill.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan W

customer_reviews.title: Glass broke in less than two months
customer_reviews.text: Glass is very very thin and apparently cracks easily. I use this daily to make cold brew and it's been fine up until tonight when I put the top on and the glass cracked and let coffee out everywhere. I've always washed it by hand and it's never been dropped so I don't think it had an existing crack that just spread so I am not sure what happened.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: I'm new to brewing coffee at home.
customer_reviews.text: Coffee people can be snobs and researching the right brewing technique and coffee type can be daunting and intimidating. This press couldn't be easier to use. After a couple of cups, I have my technique down! You've gone this far, the things I wish I'd known before purchasing: this isn't a coffee pot - you can get about two small size mugs worth. Coffee can burn! This isn't meant to let coffee sit. You've really got to pour it when it's ready. If you're only going to drink a cup, this is perfect. I'm sure those coffee snobs will tell you different, for everyone else, this is a bang for your buck gizmo.
customer_reviews.author: T James

customer_reviews.title: Spout broke very first use. Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: The spout broke upon first use. Don't know if I broke it or is poor quality item.
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: Bought two
customer_reviews.text: Pro: This french press is very easy to use and clean. I loved it so much that I bought another one. Con: The plastic piece that holds the screen onto the plunger can easily break. This one flaw can completely ruin your french press so be extremely careful. Other information: I personally like to grind my own whole beans when using this product to ensure that it's not too fine. I find that store-bought grounds sometimes does not separate as well, and I end up with grounds in my coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Mars

customer_reviews.title: Easy Coffee
customer_reviews.text: Got rid of my Keurig- kept not working, expensive cups, quality less than what I liked. Now I have always freshly ground coffee at whatever strength I am in the mood for. Takes more time to brew and clean but its worth it- I have several so I usually have a clean one- can put in the dishwasher. The only maintenance is replacing the filter screen once per quarter- bought a few year's worth for a few dollars.
customer_reviews.author: David Hanan

customer_reviews.title: Petite French Press = big flavor
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a compact French press for my morning caffine kick, this does the trick wonderfully! It's easy to use, easy to clean and makes a great cup of coffee. I will say it seems a little pricey considering the size, it might be worth it if this lasts a long time (fingers crossed) but if you make coffee for two I'd recommend going a size up.
customer_reviews.author: L - reviews

customer_reviews.title: Get the French Press on the line!
customer_reviews.text: This little one cup French Press is sturdy, well made and makes the best rich coffee. (Use coarse ground coffee) Bodum is known for its quality glass products and this is one of them. It's a simple system. Using the scoop that comes with it, put 2 scoops of your favorite coarse to medium ground coffee in the press, heat your water to your liking, pour in the press and put the top on and begin to press the metal filter down, slowly. Let sit for 4 or 5 minutes (just enough time to make a slice of toast and jam), pour in your cup and enjoy. Love this. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Rick B.

customer_reviews.title: Extremely poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I've been using coffee presses for several years, and this one is made with extremely poor quality. The glass is so thin that upon washing it after the third use, as I was rinsing it, I tapped it gently against the side of the sink and it shattered. In addition, the plastic parts of it were very cheap and flexible, making it difficult to use without gripping it tightly while pushing down the press, with the plunger of the press wobbling from side to side
customer_reviews.author: #1 mama

customer_reviews.title: Great Item
customer_reviews.text: Great to brew coffee. Easy to use and clean. Limits are the amount of coffee. If you have more than three people you will need something bigger. We have two. One for coffee and one to steamed milk to froth. Honestly, the best way to froth steamed milk is using this item. Words of advice...order two of these as you will likely drop one (soap and water and it slips from your hand).....by having the second one you won't miss a beat the next day you need coffee/frothed milk. And for $18 a pop it won't eat a hole in your wallet.
customer_reviews.author: Vacaville CA

customer_reviews.title: Great product EXCEPT FOR THE PLUNGER!
customer_reviews.text: As you may have read, this is an amazing product, but has one major flaw design, and it's a tiny flaw with big consequences, almost like the tiny ventilator shaft in the Death Star! This tiny little plastic piece at the bottom of the plunger breaks quite easily, rendering the entire product useless. I bought my first Bodum Brazil FP in 2018, and it lasted about 9 months. Then I bought a replacement in June 2019, and it lasted a year before the same little piece broke. Really disappointing as I love this coffee maker. But I guess that's how they make their business. They don't want it to last too long, so you'll be forced to buy another product.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Sharief

customer_reviews.title: ... one of these several years ago and it worked great - but I broke it accidentally
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these several years ago and it worked great - but I broke it accidentally. Bought a replacement but the mesh SS filter folded back on itself when I was pulling the plunger out. Returned to get another one - same problem! Looking for a different brand ...
customer_reviews.author: Dan W

customer_reviews.title: Great intro to French Press
customer_reviews.text: I had never used French Press before, but I got a free bag of coffee from work and had no way to use it, as I'm an otherwise Kuerig/Nespresso person. I figured this little press wasn't too much of a risk, so I tried it and I am SO GLAD I did! The coffee tastes better, is cheaper and I'm not wasting tons of plastic or aluminum. I really enjoy this little French press. It cleans really easily too. Just a quick rinse and we're good to go!
customer_reviews.author: Krista

customer_reviews.title: Carafe
customer_reviews.text: I gave all 5 stars because .... I bought this because I needed another carafe {Cat slid across counter and knocked it to the floor!} I thought that the carafe would fit in mine! Well it did not. {my mistake}. I did not read anywhere that this carafe could not be removed. This was cheaper than buying a new carafe. I have to say I got online and had to buy the regular one. BUT I thought it for about 5 mins and did not send this back cause I will use it as a back-up. So good price for a back-up!!!
customer_reviews.author: GREYWOLF

customer_reviews.title: L.O.V.E. IT!
customer_reviews.text: My DH is a coffee fanatic, and after tasking actual french coffee in Paris, I thought this would bowl him over...and it did. I'd bought a Bodum Brazil 12 Oz French Press coffee maker for my husband last Christmas...he loved it! Unfortunately the glass cracked recently (we're not sure how since it wasn't dropped or knocked over...), so I surprised him with this replacement. When he opened the box, it was ear to ear grin, again. Don't hesitate to buy - it make great coffee for an individual drinker.
customer_reviews.author: TomTom

customer_reviews.title: Bodem French Press
customer_reviews.text: I got this french press as a gift for my girlfriend and she just loves it. She seems to like the flavor and robustness of the coffee versus in a electric coffee pot. This was a nice size for the price. Arrived as stated, packaged well.
customer_reviews.author: Catz

customer_reviews.title: This is the perfect size to fill up both of your 30oz mugs ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit because the standard size french press was not big enough for my gf and I. This is the perfect size to fill up both of your 30oz mugs for the day. Doesn't do the best job straining grounds as there is definitely coffee residue at the bottom of the cup at the end of the day, but this is a problem I have experienced with every french press I have ever owned. That issue is not enough to warrant a lower rating than 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Donald M Shaw II

customer_reviews.title: Ruined by a Single Poor Quality Part
customer_reviews.text: As several other reviewers have noted, the screens on the plunger are held in place with a small piece of plastic, which failed and makes it unable to separate out the coffee grounds. I bought one of these models and it lasted about six months. When this piece failed, I bought a replacement because I liked the press so much. The second one I bought only lasted two months however, and then I read these reviews and saw how many people had the same problem. I tried to fix it, but nothing will hold the screens in place anymore. It was great while it lasted, but that was not long.
customer_reviews.author: S. Brannan

customer_reviews.title: Trusted the name Bodum but this model has a design flaw :(
customer_reviews.text: I love the modern sleek look of this Bodum French Press but after only 4 months of use the plastic piece that holds the 3 filters together failed, which prevents you from plunging the coffee. I did read this complaint by other amazon purchasers but had hoped the issue was rare. Contacted Bodum and they stated they will send a replacement "shoulder nut", stainless steel. Let's hope this provides much expected longevity!
customer_reviews.author: Jett Watkins

customer_reviews.title: Other presses of equal price are better...
customer_reviews.text: So the plastic on this seems pretty cheap and the plunger doesn’t fit directly into the beaker. You have to tilt the plunger to get around the handle that protrudes into the beaker. If the beaker is full, it spills out as you put the plunger in. I have another press that works better for about $3.00 more, just need a new beaker. Returning the one I bought.
customer_reviews.author: Latch001

customer_reviews.title: Coffee Grounds
customer_reviews.text: Probably a decent press but the filter does not prevent coffee grounds from getting into my cup. Aggravates me to be spitting out coffee grounds while trying to enjoy my cuppa joe Guess I should have read the 1 & 2 star reviews. I also noticed absolutely no response from the supplier to any of the negative responses. Shudda known. Cannot recommend the press at all
customer_reviews.author: Eaglestar

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I really like this French press so far. It works really well with the espresso I use. I was using a Pod based machine. And that doesn’t even come close to this way of making coffee. I like that you have control over how strong you want your coffee to be. Plus it’s substantially cheaper to make it this way. Build quality seems pretty solid. For $15 you can’t go wrong, I bought two so I have one as a backup. Overall worth the money. Will update this review if anything breaks. Definitely give it a try!
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Not just for brewing coffee!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 12 Oz version of this french press not to make coffee (I own another larger version for that). No, I bought this small press to froth my cream with it, and it makes coffee house good foamy cream! Simply fill it about 1/3 to 1/2 with half n half or whole milk, heat in microwave for one minute and use the plunger up and down for 15 seconds or so to create a thick and luxurious delicious foam... enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Ain't no party like a french press party
customer_reviews.text: My Mr.Coffee stopped working and when I was tinkering around with it, I saw how nasty it gets inside. Sure, this path doesn't have the easiness of pushing buttons and walking away... but I can safely say this bad boy is clean. Never any doubts. It honestly takes seconds to minutes out of my day. At that, it's the perfect size for all cups poured to remain warm. Treat yourself
customer_reviews.author: Eileen

customer_reviews.title: This is a great french press
customer_reviews.text: This is a great french press! Our roommate broke it about three months after we got it (dropped it on a concret floor from about 4 feet up, didn't stand a chance) and bought us the same brand, bigger version. Bodum seems to know what they're doing with coffee makers. Very easy to clean, durable. This was our first french press and it was a great one, we simply upgraded to a bigger version because we host people frequently and need more than 3 cups at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Fritz

customer_reviews.title: After a few months, handle broke
customer_reviews.text: I was pressing down on the morning's pot of coffee, and the handle popped off the top of the press. I'm going back to buying the metal ones. Another complaint: the plastic bottom doesn't fit securely, and it's easy to splash boiling water/coffee overflow down into the crack between the bottom and the glass, which then spills all over the place when you tip it up to pour.
customer_reviews.author: Madame Hardy

customer_reviews.title: Great for about 9 months
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely loved our french press and used it at least a few times per week. Then, after about 9 months, the little plastic part that keeps the filtration system at the bottom of the french press rod, became loose and no longer held the filtration pieces in place...allowing the 2 top pieces to stay at the top of the pitcher when the rod was pressed down.
customer_reviews.author: susan ruhlman

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: I use this every morning. I can boil twelve ounces of water in less than a minute. It takes me four or five minutes to boil a liter of water. So I make my first mug of coffee and I am enjoying it in less than five minutes, then I pour a liter of boiling water into my full sized French press and enjoy my first cup of coffee while the coffee in the big press brews. It could be designed better, to let the press go on easier, it is a little awkward and I don't like awkward when I'm dealing with boiling water before I've had my coffee. The plastic parts look cheap but they feel sturdy enough.
customer_reviews.author: scottalias

customer_reviews.title: Feels a little cheap, but definetely worth the price
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for a simple french press, this is great. It's just a french press that gets the job done, nothing special. It feels a little cheap but not to the point that it feels like it might break. As long as you're not rough with it, it should last. It's easy to clean, just run everything under water. It works with fine grain coffee (you might end up with a few grains at the bottom of your cup). Overall a good price for a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Bubba

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: So I waited quite a while to leave a review due to the bad reviews about this breaking. The glass is just as thick as any other French press I've ever owned, and as long as you aren't abrasive you will be good. Dont knock it on the side of the trash bin or aggressively scrape out grinds/leaves - gently scoop it all out with a plastic/bamboo/silicone utensil. Anyways - works great, cleans well, pours evenly. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Scarlet Jones

customer_reviews.title: Love Bodum, thin glass
customer_reviews.text: Bodum makes great french presses - you want screens that won't tear or fray and theirs are nice and strong. That said, I used this for about 6 months when the glass broke. It does have thin walls and the handle jiggled a bit, but I loved it while I had it. Keep the screen clean and you'll have a perfect cup of coffee every time. I'm replacing this with another Bodum, a version with side guards to better protect the glass.
customer_reviews.author: khaosstar

customer_reviews.title: Classic must have for coffee lovers
customer_reviews.text: I'm enjoying this press. I wish it had more filter layers though but this is a good affordable option and you get what you pay for. I use a scrubby brush to clean it and haven't had any issues with the glass or plastic parts. I like my coffee strong so I let it steep for 5 to 10 min. Definitely more than the insert says to wait. So tasty!
customer_reviews.author: Becs234

customer_reviews.title: THE STANDARD TO MEASURE ALL FRENCH PRESSES
customer_reviews.text: Well i have owned a number of these French presses and they always work good. Over the4 years there have been good ones and better ones but never a disappointment. Unfortunately they all end the same way...the fragile glass breaks. Shame they don't make them stronger but then they might last forever! heaven forbid we wouldn't want that!
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Love it! The filter works great. Good material.
customer_reviews.text: Great French Press! This is my second one as I broke the glass by accident when washing the first one. I selected the same brand as before as others did not work well with bad filtering systems. I wish they had a replacement glass and different colors for variety. I think they make them but not available for sale. Highly recommend it if you drink tea as much and as often as I do!
customer_reviews.author: NICHOLAS

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS PRESS!
customer_reviews.text: We had one just like this since they were introduced into the market over 10 years ago. WE loved it until I carelessly had it too close to the stove and melted the handle in two pieces. It lasted us so many years which is rare nowadays! We loved it so much we looked for an exact replacement and here it was! WE received it and are back to our beloved pressed coffee!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is excellent
customer_reviews.text: I got this to test the waters with french press. Now it's the only coffee I like. I drink death wish straight and it tastes wonderful. I did upgrade to a larger size shortly after getting my process for making my coffee the way I like though. I went to the 32 oz. the 32 oz gives me around 2 full cups with some room to add a little bit of cool water so I can drink it straight away.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Makes a fine cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because my last one (different brand) broke and I couldn't find a replacement beaker. Saw that this one had replacement parts available, only to find the beaker is not removable, seems a bit deceptive. Makes a fine cup of coffee, so long as accidents don't happen.
customer_reviews.author: Colby Bellemore

customer_reviews.title: Practically Perfect In Everyway
customer_reviews.text: Yay! Since quarantine my room has become my house. I feel very grateful for even small comforts such as a tiny French press are even available during these ......times where at this point, we're all pretty certain we just want it to end. TO EACH INDIVIDUAL AMAZON EMPLOYEE : YOU ARE NATIONAL HEROINES AND HEROES! A French Press isn't an essential item, but it brought me a warm fuzzy that's been dormant for sometime. Caffeine will help! Thank you so much. Warmly, Anic
customer_reviews.author: A U

customer_reviews.title: I've had Bodum French presses in the past and loved them not only for their functionality but also their ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had Bodum French presses in the past and loved them not only for their functionality but also their design/style. However, this particular model is a bit difficult to "press" down when you're done letting your coffee brew and ready to pour. Doesn't necessarily take away from making a gr8 cup of coffee but I'm already a bit cranky in the morning without my first cup and don't want to fight with my coffee maker... This is the only reason for minus 1 star.
customer_reviews.author: TTL

customer_reviews.title: Poor lid design
customer_reviews.text: We have a number of french press's so over the years they die... This was a replacement, and I was swayed by the price... The lid, you can't just push down on this lid, like you can all the rest of them on the market. You have to slide the top under the handle! Very awkward. I would never buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Forster

customer_reviews.title: Can't clean it
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this coffee maker and used it for months but as time went on I noticed more and more food getting caught between the plastic base and the glass. I tried everything (dishwasher, soaking, even my water pik) to remove it to no avail. Then I noticed something that looked like maggots in-between the plastic and glass (not positive as to what they were but they were small, white, and moving) so that was it for me. 🤮
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Perfect French press and this was a great value!
customer_reviews.text: I have had the same French Press in ivory for a few years and finally needed a new one. The red is bright and cheerful in the morning. It keeps the coffee hot even when I forget about it for a while because I'm distracted. I plan to get a larger glass one to make coffee in the frig overnight. Great value, packaged well and shipped promptly. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Rebop

customer_reviews.title: Tried and True
customer_reviews.text: Ive been a french presser for close to 30 years. I took a break with a keurig but its not a french by any stretch so when it died, back to the bodem I went. Bodem has been around for years and although they are not a fancy press they do a great job. This press has traveled the US with me and has never broken. The only con on this press is trying to find a screen when it comes time to replace. Nearly impossible. Cleaning it is no picnic either. Id prefer to throw away and start anew. Just cant beat a $20 press and an outstanding cup of coffee to boot.
customer_reviews.author: 46&lovinit

customer_reviews.title: Good French Press
customer_reviews.text: I also have the Bodum Chambord. I bought this for the road, and it brews and filters as well as the Chambord, just not nearly as much. For one or two people, though, this one is perfect. A necessity to go along with a French Press is a decent burr mill, otherwise you'll be passing a lot of fines through the filter. Don't blame the press if you're getting a little mud in the bottom of your cup. It isn't the press, it's your grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Burns

customer_reviews.title: Plunger doesn't work right.
customer_reviews.text: This is the third one of these I've owned. The first two I broke the carafes. I figured buying the same one made sense since the others were great. This one has a serious issue with the plunger. The plastic piece that holds the filter snug at the bottom of the plunger moves, so the filter slips loose when I try and press the coffee. I contacted Bodum via email and have received no response. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: stephanie white

customer_reviews.title: 1.5 Cup french press 12 OZ
customer_reviews.text: I like bodum french presses as I've owned several in the past. Unfortunately I saw "3 Cup" and thought this was a 24 oz press. 1 cup is 8 OZs so I'm pretty displeased with that. I do take my part of the blame for not looking in to it further. Maybe if I hadn't been so tired and without coffee I would have read beyond "3 cup" I'm sure this product will create a good albeit small cup of coffee until I can buy a proper coffee machine.
customer_reviews.author: adam troutman

customer_reviews.title: very nice :)
customer_reviews.text: Very nice coffee press this is my first one and I love it. Today I made coffee with it for the first time and it worked very well. Coffee tasted great and was a breeze to clean even the filter was easy to clean. I bought a smaller one because I do not drink a lot of coffee by myself. Thanks for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Atwood

customer_reviews.title: Best French press on the market, still could be improved
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using french presses for years, and I have always loved Bodum’s the best. Only giving 4 stars as I’ve had to purchase three or four in the last 6 or so years due to either broken/chipped glass or a spring malfunction in the press. Shatterproof glass and better mechanics would make this a 5 star product
customer_reviews.author: Christa

customer_reviews.title: Makes Excellent Coffee
customer_reviews.text: The French Press works fine. One of the problems is that you should use coarsely ground coffee or you can clog up the press. That means you have to grind your own beans. One of the greatest perks is that you don’t have the build up of residue to affect the taste of the coffee. That means the press makes better coffee than a drip coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: Glorious

customer_reviews.title: Nice french press for having one cup a day
customer_reviews.text: I bought this almost 2 months ago and have been using it every day since. Its pretty small, makes just one cup which is perfect for me. Very easy to clean if you do it right away. The only bad thing I can say is that the filter part has already unscrewed twice while I was using it but it is very easy to screw back into place.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: good coffee but bad for one person
customer_reviews.text: if you only make a small amount of coffee you wont get filtered all through because the press cant reach the bottom. breaks easily, had to bought a second one. but the coffee is good, 4 stars i changed the rating because we got another one (you can only use it for 2 cups, so if you have guests you need 2), and glass arrived shattered. its really thin and not stable, plus you cant clean the space between plastic bottom and glass
customer_reviews.author: Stef

customer_reviews.title: MUST use coarse-ground coffee!
customer_reviews.text: I have always wanted one of these, so I immediately bought this when my fancy, programmable coffee pot became an ant farm and I had to toss it. It is easy to use, easy to clean, and makes great-tasting coffee. I will never go back to a drip coffee maker. *Update* this thing is is the embodiment of planned obsolescence. It is supposed to be "dishwaswer and microwave safe" but if you go that route your glass will break after a few months. And Bodum offers no warranty on its glass parts. Boo on Bodum. I think I'll make cowboy coffee in one of my 60 year old mason jars until I can find something of a higher quality!
customer_reviews.author: Greta Maclean

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Good French press for the money. I really bought this bc a friend asked me to pet sit and didn't have a coffee maker. I wanted a French press anyway so I settled on this one. It does the job. You have to grind your own coffee in order to keep the coffee from going through the mesh barrier. This wasn't an issue for me but when I did try preground it went straight through. Otherwise it makes a great cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Unimpressive Look
customer_reviews.text: Just received today. Got one after trying out my daughter in law's. Not happy with the red plastic lid and base. Makes the press look cheap! 2/27 Update: While I'm not a fan of the plastic, this French Press has done its job. Some people commented that the base leaks. It does not but it does sweat and leave water on the table beneath it. Solution: just set it on a few towel. Good product. Would buy again or recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Prof. Grey

customer_reviews.title: It makes fantastic coffee.
customer_reviews.text: This french press is great. I have been using it everyday for several years now. Previously I used a Keurig and a normal drip pot, but the french press is so much better. Sometimes people complain that it is too messy, but honestly I am kind of a clean-freak about my sink area, and I have no problems with this. You just dump the grounds in the trash, rinse the rest out, and bam it's good to go. I bought my dad the same exact french press and he also loves it. He uses it more than his expresso machine at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Starter French Press
customer_reviews.text: For some reason the red is often available for much less ($14). This was a great starter French Press. I'm a convert! I deducted a start for hard to clean. On the other hand the screen has lasted much longer than I expected. It works well, but if you get grounds between the beaker and plastic base, you have to take it apart. There was a LOT of spring in this plastic handle. In about a dozen disassembly/assembly cleaning, the beaker broke. It was cheaper to buy another complete press than a new beaker. The new one is exactly the same, but takes much less effort to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Another Engineer

customer_reviews.title: This thing is very durable and sturdy (i've dropped it a few times with no damage)
customer_reviews.text: I will never go back to a coffee maker again. This thing is very durable and sturdy (i've dropped it a few times with no damage). Very easy to use and never have a problem with coffee grounds getting into the coffee. Would definitely recommend. I've used this item basically every day since I've received it and it makes the perfect cup of coffee (both my father and sister have both asked me to order them one because of the quality of coffee it made)
customer_reviews.author: D. Ioa

customer_reviews.title: Beware..........
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace one made by Mr. Coffee that I had for years. I broke the glass on the Mr. Coffee and saved the rest of the "parts". Glad I did! I used the Bodum one twice and the plastic threaded ferrule that holds the plunger/screen stuff to the rod broke. Plastic! I got out the parts from the Mr. Coffee and that part is actually metal and it was a perfect fit. Originally I thought these were all basically the same but found out NOT. Just beware that a real key component on this one is plastic. Probably a one star rating would be better but I'm glad I had an easy fix on hand.
customer_reviews.author: S. C.

customer_reviews.title: Makes great coffee
customer_reviews.text: We had the original version before and it broke. Got this one and it is really nice! Easy to clean and more stable than the original version with metal around it. Removing the handle for cleaning, however is a bit difficult. Haven’t been able to remove it! The French Press still gets clean, nevertheless. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Trevmom

customer_reviews.title: Great beginners Press!
customer_reviews.text: Most people's first French press. It's cheap, it works well, and produces some delicious coffee. Did I use it for long? No, there are much better ones (build and filter quality) but for the price it's a great starting point. I personally prefer their Chambord or whatever model to the Brazil, but at that point you might at well get a YAMA or stainless.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Eich

customer_reviews.title: Works great if you're super careful
customer_reviews.text: Great price for a little French press. Love how easy it is to clean and makes great coffee. Love it. Had it for about a month now and it’s proving itself well. EDIT: 2.5 months and the little plastic screw piece that keeps it together stripped. Totally un-usable now. Really frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Bunny24

customer_reviews.title: My third already!
customer_reviews.text: Cheap, cheerful and can’t be beaten. I’ve tried poor imitations of Bodum and they just don’t cut it. I usually break the glass carafe eventually and have to get a replacement but who cares. This is far better than any coffee machine **** I could make, and so easy if you follow the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: michelisima

customer_reviews.title: Good Press, but Not Same Quality
customer_reviews.text: This press is a classic that's been around for a while, but after breaking the glass of an old (polish made) one, I had to get a new press. This new one doesn't look like the same quality. The glass in particular isn't quite flat and looks wavy. That's just poor workmanship. I'm keeping the rating up, however, due to overall value. Especially with a $15 price tag; it isn't even worth getting a glass replacement for that.
customer_reviews.author: TheBigTime

customer_reviews.title: Works. . .
customer_reviews.text: This is a very cute product, I got it to replace another kind that a broke and it works well enough but is no where near my old quality. Due to the design it is a little awkward to get the lid on each time and then you have to force the press down because it does not flow smoothly. It does its job but you always get some coffee grounds in your cup.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good while it lasts, but you should spring for a metal one.
customer_reviews.text: This worked fine for 6 months of daily use. Unfortunately, the weakest bit is the plastic at the end of the shaft that holds the filter in place. This gave out after continued use. If you're just looking for a cheap french press that you don't use very often, this is fine, but if you are a serious coffee drinker then I recommend spending a few extra dollars for one with all metal internal components where you apply pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Jason F.

customer_reviews.title: Very good but thin glass.
customer_reviews.text: I cannot say this french press is not good. It does what it should do perfectly. Just the glass is a little thin and I didn't even notice when it broke at the pouring part. It cut my hand but not that bad. Compared to this price and I have already used it for one year. I just decided to buy a new one from IKEA. But this one looks really good and just be careful when you wash it. I still like it and use it from time to time.
customer_reviews.author: Yuntian T.

customer_reviews.title: Broke after under a year.
customer_reviews.text: As other reviewers have said, it works well until a small piece of plastic inside the press breaks, rendering the whole thing useless. The first time I thought it was a fluke, so I bought another one and, lo and behold, it happened again! I'm sure the manufacturer will offer a refund, or a replacement part, but why go through the hassle? If you want it to last , find a different French Press.
customer_reviews.author: Marie E. Hill

customer_reviews.title: works great!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had it for two months now and still brews and filters great! Filter pieces will warp if you don’t air dry each piece separately on a flat surface. It’s a little high maintenance but eco friendly! Update: 5 months later still works great! I use it everyday and with proper care has lasted a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Carlee

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting
customer_reviews.text: We recently replaced the last one we got...which we bought FOUR YEARS AGO. My only complaint with this French press is that it doesn't always filter everything as well as I would like, but I think that just goes with the territory when it comes to French presses. For the price, this is a trusty little model!
customer_reviews.author: Faith

customer_reviews.title: Top notch coffee press.
customer_reviews.text: I always make a full pot and this lid design is a little challenging to neatly press into a full pot. So, you gotta be a little careful & pay attention. Getting past that, this system makes excellent coffee. Been using Bodum presses for decades now and never disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Bad product. Broke immediately. Has plastic on plunger.
customer_reviews.text: Broke within the first week. Made with cheap plastic inside. Not thrilled to find plastic on the plunger at all. Plastic piece broke and now it cannot filter out coffee grinds sufficiently. I just trusted the brand name product would be good quality. I know, that's not a smart assumption on my part. Now I have to buy a new French press. Super disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Snaps

customer_reviews.title: Good size, leaks at base
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several french presses, and I really liked the size of this one because it can make enough for 4-5 cups. After 2 months, the base of the press began to leak (it drips out from between the glass carafe & the black metal). I am outside my 30-day return window so I guess I have to buy a new one. :(
customer_reviews.author: Fluffy_the_Turtle

customer_reviews.title: Makes coffee so smooth
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on the recommendation of a friend because I’m trying to make the switch to black coffee. She said using the press would make it less bitter and she was right. I can’t say I don’t miss my cream and sugar but I can say that I am able to drink black coffee now without gagging. LOL. I’m very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Melody

customer_reviews.title: Ok if you have time to hold it upside down for 5 minutes
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th Bodum French press and the only one that isn't right. Over several years, we managed to drop 2 but still have 2. I bought the 4th one because my husband drinks caffeine and I drink decaf, so we could have coffee at the same time. For some reason, they decided to shorten the stick that runs in down the center (that has the filter attached) and the filter doesn't squeeze out all the grounds. I have to hold the thing upside down for a long time to get all the liquid out. It's odd.
customer_reviews.author: Clem

customer_reviews.title: Lacking in longevity
customer_reviews.text: Used this product for a little over three months. A couple days ago went to unscrew the screens to clean it (as I've done before) and found that the plastic threading that connects the rod to the screen had stripped out. All the parts seems to be fairly good quality except for that one cheap plastic part at the end of the rod containing the threads. Unfortunately when that breaks, you can no longer connects the screens together or push or pull them through the coffee. RIP french coffee press. I hardly knew ye'. I gave it two stars because, well, at least it didn't like, shatter and cut me or something.
customer_reviews.author: AD

customer_reviews.title: but it is perfect for him
customer_reviews.text: I bought this small french press for my husband for Christmas. He really loves it! It truly holds only enough coffee for one person, but it is perfect for him. He says that it makes the coffee taste better than his old pour over coffee maker. My husband uses it almost daily, and it has helped up well. We had wash the plunger pieces and often just rinse the carafe. We have put the carafe in the dishwasher several times, and it has still held up well.
customer_reviews.author: B. Abraham

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: So far amazing! I got this because I was grossed out with the dip coffee. I was grossed out because of you can't disassemble it entirely to clean. I love how you can easily clean this everyday and after every use! I love how it freed up my counter immensely. I also love how it stays warm and my coffee is now hotter then the drip as well. It was a learning curve and a totally different way of making coffee in the morning but just as easy as a drip just different! Love everything but the one and only thing I would change is the size! For us this is perf
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Small but good
customer_reviews.text: I received it a while back but didn't get to use it sincr I was traveling. Please keep in mind, I mainly bought it not for coffee (which is its actual intended use) but for separating the pulp from my homemade green juice. It took me a bit too do it but I think that's normal since the pulp is more dense and mixed than coffee. But overall it looks really nice and well and works fine. It is smaller than I expected though. So make sure you consider the size. It Is perfect for one coffee but not more.
customer_reviews.author: Shakiba

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother
customer_reviews.text: This worked fine for the first few months, great coffee, easy to use, easy to clean. A big downside was getting used to only brewing 1 cup / 8 oz in this - anything beyond that, it can't handle. Then it started falling apart on me. Now every coffee I brew has grounds in it, yuck! I recommend spending the bugs to get a bigger and more durable one. I'm disappointed by this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not the best filter
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice individual size, box says 3 cups but it is 12 oz. One large cup of coffee. Perhaps 3 Espresso size? Functionality of the lid and filter is not the best. The lid only fits one way, most other french press you can rotate the lid (closed or mesh filter). So when you pour hot water, you let steep for 3-4 min with lid pour spout COVERED. This one only has a plastic filter at the lip-- NOT mesh. I wouldn't buy this again or give as a gift but it was only one that would have fast shipping during COVID-19. It better than no coffee but not the best design.
customer_reviews.author: "beachreader2"

customer_reviews.title: The way to go.
customer_reviews.text: I use this every day. Mine broke because of stupidity (I knocked it over easily 10x before I finally did it in) -- I immediately bought the same one again. Great device. perfect size for a regular sized cup of coffee. I make 3x of them a day. quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

product_meta.title: Bodum Brazil French Press Coffee and Tea Maker, 34 Ounce, Black
product_meta.description: Size:34 Ounce| Color:BlackThe Brazil French Press coffeemaker, designed in the early 80's, was our first coffeemaker and quickly became a symbol of what Bodum stands for. Attractive and functional design at an affordable price. The Brazil has a durable, heat-resistant borosilicate glass beaker and a plastic handle and base, which make the Brazil easy to use and easy to clean. The 3-part stainless steel plunger has a fine mesh filter, which allows for a premium extraction of your coffee's aromatic oils and subtle flavors. A mesh filter allows this flavor to be delivered direct to your cup and not absorbed by a paper filter. Plus, no paper filter means no waste. The patented safety lid prevents the splashing of liquids while pressing. All parts are dishwasher-safe.
feature_bullets: Add coarsely grounded Coffee. Add hot water. Wait 4 minutes. Plunge.
No paper filters or plastic capsules required.
Base and handle made of BPA-free polypropylene. Carafe made of German heat-resistant borosilicate glass. Plunger made of stainless steel
